definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Can you keep silent when you are blamed for something you never did?
sentences.chinese: 被人以莫须有的事情来指责你时，你能闭口不言吗？

sentences.english: When unwarranted expectations ultimately are not realized.
sentences.chinese: 当莫须有的期望最终没有实现。

definition: to frame/to bring false charges against
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.
pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2

definition: to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to frame sb/to cook up imaginary charges against sb
a devastating criticism/to expose hidden motives
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
